Starring: Raoul Bova, Michela Quattrociocche, Francesco Apolloni, Luca Angeletti, Cecilia Dazzi, Ignazio Oliva, Francesca Ferrazza, Francesca Antonelli, Michela Carpenter, Beatrice Valente, Rossella Infanti, Pino Quartullo, Andrea Montovoli, Chiara Tomaselli 
Rating: Suitable for all audiences 


Synopsis: 
The story continues ... Alex (Raoul Bova) and Niki (Michela Quattrociocche) are more in love than ever, just back from the lighthouse on the island where they have lived Blu unforgettable days. Niki is reunited with her friends, but the girl group will face big changes that will test their friendship. Alex takes his life forever, with his old friends. They, Flavio (Ignazio Oliva), Enrico (Luca Angeletti) and Pietro (Francesco Apolloni) have gone from being serene and safe husbands have to face many difficulties that have jeopardized their marriages. And now all these people, men and women of different ages, each in its own way, are to reflect on love. 

Production notes: 
After the success of 'Sorry if I call you love', released by EMON in April 2010 with nearly 200,000 spectators, and the recent success of 'Three Meters Above the Sky', released by Warner with over 8 million raised to date, hits theaters in Spain 'Sorry but I want to marry you', the next installment in the novels of Federico Moccia, the author best-selling literary past in Spain 2010.
